Title: AN ACT AUTHORIZING THE HEIRS OR REPRESENTATIVES OF THE LATE LUCERCIO HOFILEÑA TO BRING SUIT AGAINST THE GOVERNMENT OF THE PHILIPPINE ISLANDS AND DIRECTING THE ATTORNEY-GENERAL TO APPEAR IN SAID SUIT FOR SAID GOVERNMENT.

[ Act No. 2899, February 25, 1920 ]
AN ACT AUTHORIZING THE HEIRS OR REPRESENTATIVES OF THE LATE LUCERCIO HOFILEÑA TO BRING SUIT AGAINST THE GOVERNMENT OF THE PHILIPPINE ISLANDS AND DIRECTING THE ATTORNEY-GENERAL TO APPEAR IN SAID SUIT FOR SAID GOVERNMENT.
Be it enacted by the Senate and House of Representatives of the Philippines in Legislature assembled and by the authority of the same:
Section 1. The heirs or legal representatives of the late Lucrecio Hofileña are hereby authorized to bring suit within six months from and after the approval of this Act, in the Court of First Instance of Manila or Iloilo, against the Government of the Philippines Islands, to show what right they have, if any, to any part of the funds deposited in the year nineteen hundred in the Insular Treasury by the military authorities of the United States as funds seized from the insurgent forces, on the behalf of the Government of the Philippine Islands, to defend said Government.ℒαwρhi৷
Section 2. This Act shall take effect on its approval.
Approved, February 25, 1920.
